Good Comments: Do we really need notes on the origins of chocolate? Would Japanese viewers have known that already?
Slow, but a good job translating/subbing and a high resolution release
Absolutely the best choice for this series.
Bad Comments: Surprisingly good quality for the small 120 mb file size and also a HD quality option. ^_^
HD quality available. Avi and mkv releases. Clear font, lots of explanations of cultural references.
Relatively quick, yet good. Choose between them or Ayu. Ayu so far have slightly better colour filtering but Ayako-sae subs (and notes) seem just the bit better.
